intro: Maba hermaphroditica, commonly known as the African sand dollar, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, disk-like structure that resembles a sand dollar. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture. Maba hermaphroditica is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
